medical_history.chief_complaint: Attack of severe abdominal pain and chronic iron-deficiency anemia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: One month before admission, the patient had a sudden attack of abdominal distention and severe, steady epigastric pain with radiation to the back shortly after eating almonds. The pain lasted three hours and was not affected by intravenous morphine. Fever was reported during the episode, but no temperature was taken. The pain mostly resolved after a few hours, and he was admitted to another hospital.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic iron-deficiency anemia evaluated for four years, previous excision of nonruptured appendix at age 18, diagnosis of gastric ulcer with positive Helicobacter pylori antibodies nine months prior to admission.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had colonic carcinoma in her 80s.
medical_history.social_history: The patient did not smoke, drank one or two cups of coffee daily, and reported eating a healthy diet including nuts.
